Surfing the web on your Ipad can not get any easier. It was created so that everyone can easily learn from your 4 year old sister to your 70 year old grandmother. The buttons on the exterior of the ipad include the home, volume, and silence key and the hold button. The power and battery life of the ipad is excellent. You can go hours of surfing the web or playing games without having to keep charging it everyday.  For example, I recently went on a trip to San Francisco which took 6 hours. I watched movies on the way there and movies on the way back and didnt have to chrage it during my vacation. It was amazing to be able to use it for so long and not have to keep charging it on my trip. On my trip I was also able to factime my brother who was back at home. With the ipad you can videochat and factime anyone at anytime as long as you have wifi. This allows you to have contact with someone you havent seen for a while. It allows you to be able to see someone while talking to them at the same time. This for me is the best part of the ipad since It clearly allows me to see my brother who lives far away from me. The Apple Ipad 2 is an excellent product overall. If you are still debating whether or not to purchase an Ipad 2 you should go and play with one hands on first before purchasing. You can go to best buy or an Apple store to witness this marvelous item in action.I give the Ipad 2 five stars because I love it. It is very reliable for anything and the design of it makes it easy to use anywhere you go!

Reviews.Title: Great iPad, but not enough memory.
Reviews.Author: GA506
Reviews.Content: Purchased this iPad for my son.  It works very well, screen has beautiful color and resolution.  My biggest complaint (this is more my fault for not researching the product before buying) is that what you buy as far as memory is what you get.  You cannot increase its memory like you can a computer.  We've had to delete video and apps over the past year to make room for more.  My son really hates losing apps from time to time, but we have to if he wants to make room for a new one.  Buy as much memory as you can afford, because after a few months you may find yourself stuck.

Reviews.Title: Review of what I recieved
Reviews.Author: gabby
Reviews.Content: Not only was it late, it had no paperwork there was only one bubble protecting it the others were never aired and the box was crushed so now I need to open it before I gift it, to make sure it isn't broken...Wow

Reviews.Title: not the best
Reviews.Author: Nina Aristo
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when i got this, but as it turns out, something was wrong with the screen and the typing mechanism was weird and not very fast.... almost like the brain of the iPad wasn't working correctly. It was a birthday present for my mom and I ended up having to spend ANOTHER $400 + to buy her a new one because I felt so bad that this one didn't work.

Reviews.Title: Defective and bad quality
Reviews.Author: Young Dong
Reviews.Content: I was expecting apple item pretty much. But this time, this iPad2 really dispointed me. Less than 2 weeks after I bought it. it starts going wrong. Every time I want plug off the charges, it just goes dead. Even if I reinstalled the system, the problem still exists. I dont want it any more, and I'm so angry about it, Caz I lost many important photos and pdfs.What I really hope now is they can refund me as soon as possible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Save yourself the trouble and get something with android on it!
Reviews.Author: CameraGuy
Reviews.Content: Ended up giving this to my grandpa and getting a nexus 7Don't buy this, you will regret it!!!I went with android and now i am a fan for life, google now works much better than siri!!!

Reviews.Title: Ipad return
Reviews.Author: Marsha Shearer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item as a Christmas gift, It was not opened until Christmas day. We found that it would not hook up to Wi-Fi.  I contacted the company that it did not function properly. They said that they have a 30 day return policy and would not fix or exchange the iPad. It cost me another 199.00 to have the hard ware repaired. I will never order from this company again. And would not recommend this company to anyone.

Reviews.Title: No wifi
Reviews.Author: JudiK
Reviews.Content: I purchased a "NEW" I pad 2, with verizon wifi. When we tried to connect to wifi, it would not work.we took it to an apple store, they informed us that it was a "refurbished" Ipad.  it even had a barcodesticker on the back with a date on it, the gentleman at the apple store punched in the barcode # and itshowed that the person who had it previously also had problems with the wifi.  He also told us that Ipadsdo not come with barcode stickers on the back.  needless to say we were not happy that we paid $590 for a"NEW" Ipad and recieved a refurbished one.  So check the back of your Ipad, if there is a barcode stickeron the back IT IS NOT a new Ipad, FYI. I will keep you updated when and if we get our refund.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and functional
Reviews.Author: J. John "jjp"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, light weight, stylish and practical.....this iPad2 is excellent and i can't imagine traveling without it......it is not a replacement for the PC though.........but complements it nicely.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: John Anthony
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing device! Just an oversized iPod Touch? That comparison always amuses me. Really? Ok....then buy an iPod Touch and write letters, and read articles and/books, watch videos, etc. on that tiny little screen. One of the major points of the iPad is it's larger screen!!  Some guy wrote about how the iPad sucks because of fingerprints on the screen. Really??? He must have filthy fingers!! When using my iPad I don't ever see fingerprints that get in the way of using the device. Oh sure, I see them when the unit is OFF, and then I wipe it clean if needed. But when it's on?? Please.The iPad can be used for almost anything we normal people do- reading, entertainment, shopping, surfing the web. No flash?? True....but really, there are not that many instances that pop up where the lack of Flash is a problem. If it were a real problem, then Apple would not have sold tens of millions of the device thus far. I don't know about others but I know my company switched their entire website to one with HTML 5- good bye Flash. I'm guessing that's going to happen more and more. It has no USB or video out ports?? Ok....then don't buy it! It's amusing how people "purchase" the iPad and then moan and complain that it has no USB port or HDMI out ports. Really? You mean....you didn't know that when you bought it?  Seriously, some of the naysayers for this product that say "it sucks" and so on are clueless. This is a FANTASTIC product! Ok....so it IS a little pricey, I'll given them that. But then, so is the Galaxy Tab. Most products of this type that cost much less simply are not worth it. Maybe the Kindle Fire will be? Who knows? But I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: Tablet computer
Reviews.Author: T. Flight "preferred investor"
Reviews.Content: The Apple ipad2 is an extremely versatile tablet computer. You have nearly immediate response when you go to the internet. You can download books, games, or nearly anything from the itunes store or Amazon. The tablet must be sychronized with a master computer which must be done with a usb connector to the master computer. This is usually done when a new item is purchased and downloaded. The tablet is light and easy to carry. The battery lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: The best device for kids and adults!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ginny
Reviews.Content: The iPad 2 is amazing!  My  2 year old daughter loves the fun and engaging educational apps.  I love it because it is easy to use and travel with opposed to a netbook or laptop.  Truly a great piece of techknoelegy.

Reviews.Title: Apple Ipad2
Reviews.Author: Padwicky
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased an Apple Ipad2 32 GB as a birthday and anniversary present for my wife. Amazon was the best price on the web that I could find at that time, even cheaper than Walmart.The Ipad2 arrived in about 5 days and since that time my wife has used it continuously even more than her desktop. Kinda makes a Desktop obsolete now.

Reviews.Title: Check Out Apple.com before you purchase @ Amazon
Reviews.Author: KristiSkis
Reviews.Content: First off, I don't know if Amazon claims to have the BEST prices, but if you buy your iPad from Apple.com you are getting a MUCH better deal. Plus right now they are engraving it for free. iPad 2 - 16 for 499.00, w/ 3G 629.00. You can even go to Walmart and get it for that price. I also thought that ALL iPads had to be sold at the same price - I could be wrong here, because I heard that through a friend. I don't know how long of a wait shipping is here, but as of this writing, my delivery date would be July 22-24.So, if you don't mind the wait and you want the best deal for your iPad 2, Apple is the best bet. Or play it by ear and hope Walmart has one in stock and get it the same day.PS. My 5 stars rates the actual iPad itself. It's a great tool and I absolutely love it. Goes anywhere and the fact I can FaceTime with friends across state/ country is totally Star Trek, (I mean, this man totally knew what was coming. In the 60's, can you imagine.)I originally bought the 32GB with wi-fi only. Figured since you are not bound by a contract, (ie. 2 years to subscribe) I would get the 3G just in case I ever wanted that feature. You cannot upgrade. If I were to go on a trip, I could subscribe to 3G for a month and then cancel. THAT is AWESOME.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet But Not Perfect
Reviews.Author: David L. Williams
Reviews.Content: I love my Ipad2. It is fast, very reliable and stable, and just plain fun.  But there are a few things that keep it from being perfect.  First, as other reviewers have commented, the camera is the pits and really not up to Apple's ususal outstanding quality.  The second issue, in my opinion, is the slick aluminum back side material.  It looks pretty but really necessitates a case because it is slippery and without a means to get a better grip, it is only a matter of time before the inevitable fall.  I found the same problem with my Iphone.  It would be a much better devise if Apple used a rubberized type material on the back.  I spent alot of time comparing the Ipad2 with the Motorola Xoom at Best Buy before making my purchase, and I really don't think you could go wrong with either tablet.  The Xoom has a far better camera and does flash which might be a big plus if you are really into video and gaming. But flash also comes at a cost in performance and stability which is exactly why Apple doesn't use it.  The Ipad2 seems more intuitive to me and just seems to work better and do things quicker. But I have to admit that my familiarity with Iphone may partly influence my opinion on that point. Ipad also has many more apps available at the moment. One other drawback though,in my opinion, is the need to tether the Ipad to Itunes. I understand their logic, but I really wish it had a simpler PC-Ipad interface. Honestly if I didn't already have an Iphone I might have been inclined to buy the Xoom, but that's not taking anything away from the Ipad2 - it is a great tablet!

Reviews.Title: For those of you on the fence ... (gamers especially)
Reviews.Author: H. Wang "nycmode"
Reviews.Content: By now there are plenty of reviews that offer the pros and cons of the iPad 2 versus other tablets on the market.  With that in mind, I've decided to focus this particular review only for those of you who are in the same boat as me - which is debating whether or not to upgrade to an iPad 2 from the first gen iPad.After giving it much thought, I recently took the plunge and I am 100% sure that I made the right decision.  However, this is only in the context of how I use the tablet, which is primarily for gaming and other graphic intensive apps.  Previously I owned the AT&T; 3G iPad with 32GB of memory.  After giving it much thought, I decided to purchase the wi-fi only 64GB iPad 2, since I realized I don't actually used the 3G much.Most of the apps I use are very graphic intensive.  EA games such as Dead Space, FIFA 11 ... or Gameloft games such as Order & Chaos, Starfront, and Dungeon Hunter ... I play those games often and noticed a HUGE difference after I transferred my data to the iPad 2.  The games run much better, and there is a major change in terms of performance.  There is much less slowdown, and FIFA 11 actually plays like the way it should - fast and crisp (and not slow and turgid, like it was when I was playing the exact same game on the first gen iPad).  In cases like this - having the faster processor and added RAM makes a huge difference.Now if you're the kind of person who plays simpler, less graphic intensive games like Angry Birds, Diner Dash or World of Goo, you will probably not notice anything different.  You also won't really notice any difference if you stream or purchase videos as the display is the same as before.  Sorry, but no retina display this time around.But what you will be pleased with is the fact the iPad 2 is far lighter than it's predecessor.  This is important for those of you who spend a lot on the iPad playing games (like me).  It was no secret that the previous iPad was bulky and difficult to hold.  It also made it very tiring to grab the device for an extended period of time (making it difficult to play intense FPS or sports game without frequent rest periods).  The iPad 2's weight makes it much easier to hold and less burdensome to play games for a long time.  Long story short, my hands don't feel numb as often as I did when I used the old iPad.As for the other bells and whistles such as the camera/face time, etc ... all of that is well and good.  The interface is easy to figure out, so there isn't much brain surgery involved.  The smart cover is also a nice touch, though it's not a necessity.  I personally have one though, and I like it very much.So the biggest question here is - should you upgrade to iPad 2 if you already own one?  If you are a die hard gamer, the answer is 100% absolutely yes.  The difference in performance is absolutely striking and you will see the benefits of upgrading within seconds (so long as you play games that take advantage of the upgrade - i.e. games w/high production value).Even the apps I run outside of games run noticeably smoother and faster.  Using video/graphic intensive apps like CNN or ESPN XL is a snap, and they run much faster than on my previous iPad.In short, should you upgrade from the iPad to the iPad 2?1. If you play hardcore, graphic-intensive games - YES, upgrade ASAP2. If you run a lot of apps at the same time, like to use video/graphic intensive apps - YES, upgrade3. If you run apps that aren't that taxing (lighthearted games like Angry Birds, simple interface apps), or use the ipad to mostly surf, write email, etc - NO, upgrading is not necessary unless you have cash to spare (save your $$ for the iPad after the iPad 2 IMO).That's my 2 cents for folks on the fence.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: I love my iPad!
Reviews.Author: AF Pilot
Reviews.Content: I have the 64GB with AT&T; 3G.  I absolutely love my iPad.  It does everything and i've been impressed with it in the 2 months that i've owned it so far.  I use it primarily as my internet browser, an e-reader, and to stream Netflix.  It's a revolutionary  product for me.  The iPad has replaced my laptop as my go-to for internet.  I no longer take my laptop with me on business trips.  The iPad does everything I need.  It doesn't replace the need for a computer, but it does allow me to travel without my laptop and to leave the laptop in the office (or the kitchen where it usually lives) when I want internet access on the couch.Here are some of the key features that I use:The web browser is the real deal.  It's full internet and not a mobile browser.  I like surfing the web on my iPad better than on my computer because the touch screen and gestures are very intuitive.Facetime and Skype look great and are easy to use with the dual cameras.  It's nice to be on the road and be able to see my daughter any time I have an internet connection (Facetime requires WiFi, but you can Skype on the 3G).As an e-reader, I haven't used it to read a full book yet, but I do often use iBooks to crunch PDF files that I use for work.  It allows you to search and bookmark.  The bookmarks then transfer to your iPhone via MobileMe.  It's nice because I have literally thousands of pages of regulations and tech orders at my fingertips in a very portable format.  The backlight screen is nice when reading in a dark environment and I've found it comfortable to use when reading for 15-20 minuets.  I haven't read any longer than that, so I don't know if it will cause eye fatigue over a longer period.Video looks great.  64GB is plenty of space.  I'm currently carrying 17 movies, about 11 GBs of music, 10 GBs of Apps, all of my books and I still have about 20 free GBs to load anything else.  I could probably have gotten away with the 32 GB model.Netflix streaming is awesome!  They have a great selection and the app looks really good.Games on the iPad are really fun.  I have a few board games and you can sit across from someone and use the iPad as your Monopoly board.  The large display makes it a pretty social device.The news apps look really good and have the feel of reading a magazine.Pros - It does everything.  It looks good, is very light and the battery performance is fantastic.  Apple's claim of 10 hrs of use is true.  The battery really lasts a long time.  The 3G service is a good deal.  I don't always use it, so you can set the 3G up to "pay as you go".  If you need to use the 3G, you can enter your credit card info right into the iPad and sign up for a month of service.  It's $15 for 250 MB and $25 for 2GB.  You can cancel without a penalty and there's no long term commitment.Cons - Price.  The iPad is expensive, and you could buy a laptop for the same price (or cheaper).  It's a great device and I think it's worth it, but the price is pretty steep.  Lack of Flash support, which is common to all iOS devices.Overall, I really love my iPad, I use it for everything and I take it with me routinely.

The apps that can be downloaded such as study sets app is great for reinforcing material to be learned (as are many other apps!). I also have netflix app and with the AV cables, I can plug it into any television and watch it on the big screen or take it with me while waiting at the doctors office and watch a movie...it's awesome. Again, apple has won me over!

I could just feel and smell the greed from these vendors. My suggestion is if you could wait for another month or so, the supply issue will stabilize and bring the Ipad 2 prices back to its normal price without the price gouging. You could also order from Apple online which I did and I got mine in 8 days. So the choice is yours if you want to support these greedy vendors or get it in 8 days from Apple online.

The kids also love to use it to take their own pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: Disclaimer: I a true Apple Fan, only recently converted...
Reviews.Author: T. Clifton "Techie Tony"
Reviews.Content: I'll mix it up a little and start with the things I don't like about the iPad 2. I sold my iPad 2 a while back, but I now have an iPad 3 and iPad Air. 4 iPhones, and an iMac.  On the other side of the fence I own a Kindle Fire HDX 7", and did own a 7" Lenovo tablet, both of which I like also.  Obviously the only draw-back I can think of with the iPad 2 is the poor resolution, which probably isn't even that big of a deal to some people. To me it's a deal breaker, and that is why I sold my iPad 2, however when I got the iPad 3 and realized how much heavier it was, I actually kind of regretted getting rid of my older version!  I absolutely love the light weight of the 2, ALMOST as much as I love the Retina display of the successive models.  I honestly can't tell any real difference in the speed of the 2, vs. the 3, vs even the Air! I guess I'm not all that much into games anymore, which is probably the only place the upgraded power and speed of the newer iPads would ever come in to play anyway!  As I mentioned before, the Retina display to me is a very worthwhile tradeoff even for a heavier iPad.  I actually prefer my iPad w/ Retina and keyboard case to a much more expensive Mac book Air, without Retina display. The reason being, no matter how close you set the iPad to your eyes (such as laying in bed with it sitting on your chest, the clarity is just like reading printed material right out of a book, and to me that's more important than a big screen any day of the week! I much prefer the new fire wire charging cables over the 32 pin one that the iPad 2, android tablets, and other phones use.  I hate having to worry about which side is supposed to be up or down...  The reason I would go with an iPad 2 over any of the other Android tablets, including the Kindle Fire, even though probably all the android tablets have far superior hardware for the same amount of money, is that iEnvironment. iOS, iTunes, iCloud, better quality apps, even from the exact same software on iOS vs. Android.  Owning something from Apple is not about a status symbol or anything like that for me, to me it's like owning a piece of art that makes my heart go pitter-pat every time I pick one up or sit down to relax with one on my chest.  My satisfaction and joy of owning and using such device with such a OS and compatibility with everything in my book is well worth the extra money that Apple charges for their devices.  I'm also very proud to support an American company, versus a Chinese or Korean one... sorry, but do you haters even stop to think that all the Chinese and Korean equipment use poorly paid and poorly cared for cheap labor in China just like Apple does... duh!

Reviews.Title: Hardcore android fans will fine the ipad limiting.
Reviews.Author: Jaunell
Reviews.Content: As an android fan I found three things about the ipad that I liked1) Battery life is PHENOMENAL2) Some of the apps I use on android have better versions on the ipad (this is largely due to the OEM fragmentation of android and a more uniform OS and hardware situation with apple)3) Lots of accessoriesAs an android fan I found a bunch of things I didn't like1) Almost everything has to go through itunes/apple2) No widgets/home screen customization.3) No Amazon MP3 downloads4) No CLEAR access to device flash memory.5) Only apps from the apple app store can be installed6) second hand google apps7) Maps and GPS don't work WELL8) No flash. (although there aren't anymore official android flash player updates. It can still be installed)9) One app at a time (I'm spoiled by my note 2)

Reviews.Title: Could it get any better?
Reviews.Author: boodger1
Reviews.Content: This Ipad exceeded my expectations in every way possible. There were barely any scratches and no dings. It works great and holds a charge for what seems like forever. Definitely feel like i lucked out on a practically brand new product!

Reviews.Title: Great device, even though its 2 1/2 years old
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Shames "DrJeff"
Reviews.Content: This model came out in March 2011, and me and 3 other family members have had one since June 2011.Despite the age of the model it has not become obsolescent like many other gadgets. It runs the latest IOS 7 and apps perfectly. The battery still holds a full charge, and all of the buttons and features still work (I could not say the same about my 4 year old Ipod Touch...).I use it primarily for web browsing, email, Facetime and e-books.This model does NOT have a retina display. Although Retina is nice it makes no difference in day to day use, including viewing photos. So what if I can see dots close up? I am certainly not bothered by them.Sure its fun having the most up to date toy, but having the new Ipad Air would not enhance the enjoyment that I get from the device one bit.Still, it seems like chutzpah for Apple to sell an old model for $400, so if I were in the market, I would look at used/refurbished models. The device is very well built and reliable so I wouldn't worry about getting a used one in good condition.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: I bought this for traveling purposes, so i don't have to take along my rather large lap top computer. I ended up buying the carrying case that has the keyboard attached to it as well as the protection screen.  Works great!

Reviews.Title: Beware of the difference between New and Unused
Reviews.Author: Laura Twombly
Reviews.Content: I bought this iPad as new, but learned when I received it that while it had a charger, it was not the one shipped from Apple, and there was only 40 days left of its 2 year warranty. It did not work, so we took it to the Apple store and they replaced it with a used iPad that at least had a 90 day warranty. The seller says he would have replaced it too, but does not think warranty is important to most folks. To his credit, he gave me the requested refund so I only paid for a used iPad.

Reviews.Title: After 2 years
Reviews.Author: sauprankul
Reviews.Content: I got this iPad in October 2011, according to the engraving on the back, and since 2 years seems to be the extent of most gadgets' life these days, I simply had to make a review. A good one, of course.PROS:Weight: By far, the most amazing thing about this tablet is that it weighs so little. I believe it weighs less than any other iPad out there, which is weird, but I think the iPad mini is supposed to cater to those who have a problem with that. The iPad isn't meant to be held in one hand, though. It's a real personal computer, only in tablet from, and you must treat it as such. If you need to be able to read in bed or something, get a kindle or iPad mini. However, you'll find that the iPad is very convenient for most uses.Design: The front of the iPad is defined by a single pane of multitouch glass - and a home button. The back is made of aluminum. There is a front camera, a rear camera in the top right corner, and a speaker at the bottom. This simplistic design, which Apple litigiously fought for against Samsung, is in a word, magical. I'm not too much into the marketing stuff, but seriously, there is something extremely premium about Apple products, and I am sure it is more than the pseudo philosophical marketing. The Smart Cover actually works really well, though its necessity is... debatable. Overall, this tablet feels like its worth 500 dollars. Ok, so it's 400 now, but you know what I mean.Durability: The primary user of this tablet is an unhygienic now-9-year-old who is not exactly dexterous and immediately gets on it after school, sin lavar sus manos. If you know glass, you know that the only thing that can really scratch it are minerals. That's right. Not knives or cleats, though they may if you try hard enough. It's finger salts, salt from food, dust, dirt, sand, jewelry like diamonds and quartz. However, today I wiped off all the prints with a damp hand towel and I could count, I kid you not, 3 micro scratches. That's amazing. This tablet has been dropped, probably not from extreme heights, but still. The glass at the corners, along with the aluminum housing, is tattered. There are several deep scratches in the aluminum on the back. However, there are no functional damages to this tablet. That's also very nice. You probably don't need the Smart Cover for its protective aspect. You will however, want it so you can use it for support. It helps a lot.Display: Eek. I'll kick it to you straight; the resolution of this screen is terrible. If your going to be looking at pictures, you're going to be disappointed. 1024x768 doesn't cut it. My 4.5 inch S2 had a resolution of 800x640. I thought it was sub par, but acceptable. The iPad is just bleh. It's colors are amazing though. I don't know too much about outdoor performance, but I've never felt that brightness was an issue, so it's probably ok. What the iPad lacks in detail more than makes up in size. Laying down in bed with a ten inch screen feels so empowering. I feel like I have all the media in the world in my hands, and I almost do.Apps: I don't use my iPad for work. It stays at home most of the time, and at home, I have my desktop. I would assume it would be pretty easy to use iWork to create, but I wouldn't know. *flame alert* I believe Android is better for smartphones, and iOS for tablets. There is a serious lack of tablet apps for android, but I am continually surprised at the growing iOS tablet app ecosystem. However, there are a greater variety of apps on Android, in my experience. The iPad can actually handle games pretty well, despite its age. That all I really need to say. There isn't any calculator or weather or stocks app, but you'll find great alternatives in the App Store.Camera: Why are you reading this? What are you doing with your life? Why would you want to use the iPad's camera for anything except FaceTime? Seriously? Well, that's all you're going to be able to do, because the cameras on the 2 are terrible. Really. I would expect more for 500 bucks, but whatever. It's not a priority. If you ever find yourself in so dire a situation that you need to use the iPad camera, you better invest in a disposable, or something.Battery life: Ho ho. Tee hee. The battery life of the 2 makes me want to giggle. Even 2 years later, the battery life still feels virtually infinite. I can almost guarantee you, you will never have a problem with the iPads battery life. This is because if the square cube principle. The surface area (screen size) increases at rate of the dimensions, squared. The volume, cubed. More volume means more battery. So, theoretically, the bigger the device, the longer the battery life. Oh, and iOS is super efficient, almost forgot that.Performance: Welp, iOS7 is here. Anybody with anything older than 2012 must upgrade to escape the lag! Not so. Though the animations in iOS7 are super slow and can induce "motion sickness", the iPad 2 handles it pretty well. (I swear, auto correct has something against the word we'll.) The gaming isn't bad for such an old device, though I have yet to try out newer games like asphalt 8. However, you'll be able to stream video (not in hd, of course!) and play 2d games  with no hitches. The keyboard does sometimes take a while to pop up and apps do take somewhat longer to load, but hey, we're talking about an old geezer tablet here.Features: I haven't been able to use Bluetooth to transfer files yet, presumably because Apple wants me to upgrade and use AirDrop. Classic Apple. And I'm pretty sure Siri could easily run on the 2. Oh well, looks like we're stuck with... The two doesn't have any gimmicks, per se, to it. It has the dual cameras, but that's about it. There is nothing to show off. Just to experience. FaceTime is great, though. Like, wow. It's really the best video chat technology I've ever seen. If nothing else, I would commend apple on its FaceTime infrastructure. It's simple and fun and convenient, not to mention powerful.Overall: Even after 2 years of not so nice treatment, my 2 is functionally perfect. It really feels amazing to be able to consume content on such a big screen. The thinness and lightness of the device make it disappear as you're using it. FaceTime really is the best interpersonal video chat platform as of today. IOS 7 runs fine on this, but don't expect to be so lucky next year. I was actually shocked to see the price here on Amazon. Really? 400 bucks for a 2011 tablet? When the 5 is just around the corner and will cost only 100 more? Only a fool would buy it now. However, the 2 really bolstered the image of Apple I had. I have a first gen Nano that actually still works for a whole day! I would expect the iPad to do the same. This review isn't recommending that you buy the 2. All I'm saying is that Apple makes the best tablets out there. Even the most hardcore Android fanatic (which I am dangerously close to) could agree on some levels. iPads are feat for consuming content. Maybe even for creating. However, if you want to get real work done, you're going to want to wait for the next generation of windows 8 pro tablets with Broadwell Chips in them. I need an IDE to be able to do programming when I go to college, and the fact that no such software is available for iOS means that I can't take this there. The iPad isn't a complete replacement for a real computer. But it comes pretty darn close.Sent from my iPad

Reviews.Title: perfect apple product for my 3 year old
Reviews.Author: Mrs Fluffurs ":)"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 3 year old son as an upgrade to his ipad 1. He has been very proficient at using ipad from a very early age. itunes store has a huge selection of learning apps for his age group and younger. My son has been a ipad and ipod user sinc he was about 9 months old, he thinks he is playing, but he is really learning. He is way ahead of where he should be and he has had a ton of fun doing it. After ios 6&7 came out his ipad 1  was no longer able to keep up with the technology of the upgraded apps. I purchased the 64g ipad 2 so he would have plenty of room for his apps since some of the apps can be large downloads. i am able to also to limit what he is able to do in settings and the app store. He can only get apps ifi unlock it. ipad 2 was easy to child lock certain features and content. ipad 2's long battery is great on trips, it keeps him busy and i dont need active wifi for his apps to work. I wish that ipad existed with my other children. I like that he is learning on current to future technology that most daycares or preschools can not provide.  I recommend this to any parent. The ecpense is worth it. A childs education id priceless. ipad 2 is perfect for facilitating that.TJ

If you just want iTunes, some games, and some Internet surfing, the iPad is great, but if you want all of that plus something fully operational, you'll need to buy a competitor's brand. The iPad is pretty, though--which is what Apple does best. My husband and I have 2.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad 2 (64GB AT&T; 3G)
Reviews.Author: Dr. Daniel Brewer
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner of an Apple iPad 2 (64GB AT&T; 3G) since the date of it's first released in the US on March 11, 2011. After more than two years of heavy use both personally and professionally I can say the Apple iPad changed my life. It is without a doubt one of the most innovative, useful, and powerful products on the market. That was true in April of 2010 when Apple released the first iPad, and it remains true to this day. An unimaginable number of iPad reviews exist online, so I will not restate the specs or the seemingly endless uses and applications. I will simply state that I have never regretted my purchase of my iPad for one second and I have found it to be one of the most versatile, useful, and simple pieces of technology I have ever owned. It's multipurpose functionality cannot be overstated. I cannot speak highly enough of the Apple iPad - and look forward to the day when I can upgrade to the latest model. Even so, my iPad 2 continues to be fully functional, fast, and sturdy. Why wait - BUY APPLE!

Reviews.Title: Ipad 2 is good but not great.
Reviews.Author: J. Chang
Reviews.Content: First, I am tech savvy. I mainly use a PC. I have owned an iphone before. Don't use macs. This is my first ipad. It was given to me as a gift. I use android based phones.My impression is that the ipad is very much like the iphone. Exactly the way you get into the phone you do the ipad. The icons are identical. So if you're coming from those other devices it's nice to have the same icons that you're already familiar with.Overall I'm happy with the unit. My only real complaints are the camera, speakers, no siri and lack of microsd card slot. The camera is horrible. I was shocked to learn the mexapixel that comes stock on this device. I don't think it's even 1 megapixel but for taking pictures it's really bad. Very grainy. Video recording is in hd so when the video does come out the picture is good quality. But the camera pictures are horrible.The speakers are mono. I'm not sure why they are mono on such a flagship device. They sound ok but i figured you would at least get stereo speakers with something that costs over $400.Lack of microsd slot. Now this is really bad. iphones dont have them either. neither do their ipods. it's a great way for apple to make more money since you can't upgrade the storage capacity. Android tablets and phones I'm able to add up to 64gb of extra storage. So with this device I'm locked in to what storage I buy. That's apple's deal so take it or leave it.No siri. Upgrading to os 6 I thought that I would at least get siri. No. Apple won't allow that. Kinda sad for their once top of the line tablet. Ok but not really a big deal. Just would have been a nice feature.If I were in the market for a new tablet now, I would seriously consider the Samsung Note 10.1. It can do everything the new ipad can do and more.

Reviews.Content: A great product, with the wi-fi keyboard it takes care of everything that I would have used my laptop for.

Reviews.Title: Apple Ipad
Reviews.Author: FingerLakes33
Reviews.Content: II like the Apple Ipad better than other tablets since the operating system is so much more friendly. I have an android phone and do not like the Android operating system on a tablet. The Safari search engine works very well and is easy to navigate. The applications and all iTunes store are great for anyone. The battery life lasts a long time too.

Reviews.Title: ipad
Reviews.Author: SAndy
Reviews.Content: I have had my ipad for less than a month and do not know how I got by without it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Handy
Reviews.Author: D. Oppenheim
Reviews.Content: I really like this iPad. I just couldn't give it 5 stars because the display looks alot less sharp than my iPhone 4S. I know this does not have the retina display, which is why, but it just still irritates me a bit when I use it. If I knew the new iPad would have been out soon, I would have held out on buying this until the new iPad with the retina display was out. Anyway, this iPad is still useful. I use it mostly for reading/writing emails and surfing the web while sitting on the couch. Sometimes I use Facetime which works well since my Wifi connection is fast. This thing runs smoothly and is pretty fast. The games for iPad are pretty fun to play on thing as well. Also, I find the camera is not all that great indoors and most of my indoor photos look grainy. Overall a good product but not the sharpest screen.

Reviews.Title: Trés bon produit
Reviews.Author: LANGLAIS
Reviews.Content: Je n'ai rien à dire, c'est la meilleure génération.Pratique, léger et moins cher que les nouvelles générations.A acheter

Reviews.Content: This is one of those must have products, it definitely will grow on you. The longer you have it the more useful it will become. Not only can you use it as a camera, but it can become your mobile office and library. I have used many of its features such as getting cheap kindile books on it, magazines, notes, answered email, searched the web, used the calender, looked up the weather. In short I have become I ad addicted.

Reviews.Title: HAPPY !!!

Reviews.Content: I had been wanting an ipad for a while. Mostly for movies and browsing the internet or occasionally listening to music. It is very user friendly and it came a few days before I had expected which is always nice. I hardly need my computer anymore. I just use my Ipad instead.

Reviews.Content: Cant say enough about this tablet, easy to operate and get around on it, it completely suits my needs. in fact i ordered another

Reviews.Content: The iPad came as advertised but the charger that was included wouldn't charge it. I spent $20 on a new one and it works fine. The back and edges of the iPad showed some use, nothing a protective case wouldn't hide. The screen was in perfect condition, it looked brand new.

Reviews.Title: VERY VERY NICE
Reviews.Author: Lj krazy
Reviews.Content: THE BUYER IS ON TIME AND THE PRODUCT IS EXACTLY WHAT THEY SAT LIKE BRAND NEW STILL NO PROBS AND MY 6YR OLD LOVES IT HAVNT PUT IT DOWN YET......

Reviews.Title: Terrific.

Reviews.Content: On time, perfect condition, and the product is great. Xmas gift for a family member. Everyone should get one. Apple has done well.

Reviews.Title: ipad

Reviews.Content: This ipad shipped in time for Christmas just as described. It looked great and worked great. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. I was very impressed with the sale as a whole.

Reviews.Title: Awesome iPad

Reviews.Content: A top of the line iPad with an incredible 64 GB and very reasonable price !!!A can't miss buy !

Reviews.Title: Apple Ipad Loved it

Reviews.Content: This product is perfect.  It is exactly as described.  It works and looks as new.  I came in original packaging.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it!
Reviews.Author: keeeem
Reviews.Content: In the words of my boyfriend, "that iPad was a great investment, you use it all the time!" And I do use it all the time, it has made my workflow a lot more enjoyable and makes things easier to view, more enjoyable to process and ties in my interests with the apps and everything. The seller who I got this from gave me a great deal and he shipped it promptly and kept up with messages to give me info about it. It came brand new sealed in its box and I have been jubilant ever since I carried the box from the post office to my house. I take it with me everywhere and I use it for a lot of different things such as checking my email, pinterest, stumble upon, writing on blogsy and pages, as well as drawing and creating custom cards on procreate (a beautiful art app) and a bunch of other apps that work with me. I do my couponing on this iPad and I just absolutely love it. I have an android wifi only device and I wanted to work with the iOS system in order to see it for myself, and I love both, for my uses, each platform resonates perfectly for me for what I use it. I am also a budding app developer and I like working both platforms. (: I love my iPad 2!

Reviews.Title: bomb

Reviews.Title: iPad 2
Reviews.Author: Bex
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with our purchase. We had one very happy boy on Christmas!! We couldn't be happier! Thank you

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Envy
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product for everyone. The controls are simple enough for even my parents to understand (lol, I love them, but they're a little slow on the technological uptake), but the functions it provides and the apps that can be added are able to provide complex operations tailored to suit any need.The battery life is amazing. I can use it almost continuously for approximately twenty hours before I need to reuse it. Less if I'm using heavy graphics, etc. But even then it functions for around sixteen hours. It charges very quickly when turned off and plugged into the wall. The screen is very responsive, and the keyboard is not as difficult to use as I had feared (this is referring to the larger keyboard that appears when you turn the device side-ways. The smaller keyboard is more difficult, but not impossible). The only downside I see to the keyboard is that I can't select Spanish letters and accents. I hear that there may be a way to get them, but I haven't had success thus far.All in all, a wonderful device. I love it, and would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: iPad 2 64GB
Reviews.Author: Michele Carter
Reviews.Content: The iPad overall is very nice. It runs smoothly and having the extra storage space is great. The only negative thing I have to say is that the screen is not the best compared to the retina display on the newer iPads and iPhones, but that is perfectly fine because of the price.

Great product, good job Apple

Reviews.Author: Alpal
Reviews.Content: I bought this iPad 2 right when the new ones came out because I thought this was the best price.  My excuse to buying such an expensive product was that I was studying for the CPA exam and thought the apps would be helpful.  For me this is the perfect amount of space (I havent run out yet and I have tons of games and other social apps and email)  I use mostly for personal and it is my favorite toy in the world.  I would recommend going this route instead of investing in a brand new iPad or other tablet.  You wont find as good apps as you will with apple.  I live in SC and bought it from someone in GA used.  It was like brand new plus i got a free case and screen protector which I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND to anyone who purchases one of these.

Reviews.Title: Excellent

Reviews.Title: First Apple Product.
Reviews.Author: Grace G
Reviews.Content: The iPad2 is my first Apple product. The packaging is very nice. iPad itself looks amazing, but a bit heavier than I thought it would be. That might be me... but I always thought iPads would be a bit lighter. Nonetheless it is amazing. I use the iPad for any e-textbooks. It is easy and simple to use.The downside is that I upgraded to iOS6, anddd the preinstalled YouTube app is no longer there. I wish the app store had a better selection as well. Most apps are mehh-- ok. Also wish that one day you can delete the preinstalled apps. Some apps I really don't need.

Reviews.Title: The Apple IPad Second Generation is great!
Reviews.Author: Ms. Heeder
Reviews.Content: The Apple IPad Second Generation is awesome! When my dad got it, all he had to do to be able to use it was activate it on the computer. It has really cool features. It has a camera and it can play videos and movies. It can also play games, surf the web, and more! Sometimes my dad lets me use it. Most of the time, I enjoy using it. Also, it's pretty much a big IPod Touch. This product can be your all in one device!  I really like Apple products, and this product is a pretty good Apple product. You probably would like it if you're one of those people who like Apple products. You might not like it if you like Samsung tablets better. I think the Apple IPad Second Generation is a great product!

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: There is still alot I need to learn about the iPad 2, but so far it is wonderful. It has a ton of apps to use, so you never get bored. Having a good time with it.

Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Content: Love it will look forward to ordering more in the future ;)))!!!! It was in great condition received on time and I absolutely don't regret getting it at all thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Ivory
Reviews.Content: The shippment is quick.The ipad is cool. And I am hunting for some interesting app to install.  Wish there is more free app there.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: It works just great.  I use it all the time.  I  was asked to review the product.  It would have been hard to do with iPhone

Reviews.Title: A Fun and Convenient Tablet
Reviews.Author: The Life & Times of a Book Addict
Reviews.Content: At first, I thought the idea of having an iPad was silly, until my friend was telling me of the benefits of having one. I debated and after some time I got the iPad 2. Now I love it. I take it with me everywhere I go. To school, work, etc.. I use it to write, watch movies, check email, music, and the occasional games. The main thing I use it for is to read e-books. I like that I can have a Kindle app, a Kobo app, and a Nook app all in one place without having to have several different e-readers. I like to get certain books on certain apps, especially if the price for a book is more affordable than another. Having an iPad just makes things a little more convenient. I love it.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: baltierm
Reviews.Content: I love love Love my new iPad. I bought it mostly for work, but I am on it all the time time.

Reviews.Title: Works Good as per my expectation
Reviews.Author: AmazonShopper
Reviews.Content: this iPad 2 came almost like new, works good. Solves my purpose. performance of ipad 2 is excellent for a normal user, until unless u are using it for High end games or memory sucking apps.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Ruthie
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my ipad very much.  I have no complaints about it and love being able to place on my kitchen counter and follow recepies.  It is very handy being able to carry it with me.

Reviews.Title: Ipad 2
Reviews.Author: Mr. Floyd M. Heafner
Reviews.Content: Being new to the MAC world, learning the IPad operation has been a challenge but one worth undertaking. So far I am very impressed with this unit and still learning it's capabilities. I tried another tablet last year and the connection speeds and operation was so frustrating that I returned it immediately. The Ipad 2 is very efficient even though I have to go to several different places to learn it's operation i,e, Itunes then ICloud, next Ibooks and Safari and much more to come I am sure.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: xWolf
Reviews.Content: My mom bought this for my dad and its awesome! I can bring it anywhere and its small enough for my backpack. Small and Convinient. I recommend you get this!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely great!
Reviews.Author: Tristin
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have gotten a better deal. My iPad worked just like new without any marks or scratches. It was sent really quickly and I got it way before anticipated. This was a great purchase and I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: A revolutionary device but not a laptop replacement
Reviews.Author: rkruger
Reviews.Content: Destroyed my laptop in a usual manner - drop from the counter.  Bought an iPad 2 and tried to use it as a laptop replacement.  I did last several months and didn't really feel that my range was somehow limited.  Eventually I purchased a laptop to use on a long trip.  It was a huge relief to go back to a bigger screen, fixed keyboard, windowed environment, and faster processing speeds.iPad is a revolutionary device and I find its design and build quality outstanding.  However, once the novelty wears off, it becomes apparent that it is best at supplementing your other mobile devices, not completely replacing them.The device is also fragile, so make sure to buy a sturdy case, especially if you plan to use your device in the field.

Reviews.Author: rkruger
Reviews.Content: Destroyed my laptop in a usual manner - drop from the counter.  Bought an iPad 2 and tried to use it as a laptop replacement.  I did last several months and didn't really feel that my range was somehow limited.  Eventually I purchased a laptop to use on a long trip.  It was a huge relief to go back to a bigger screen, fixed keyboard, windowed environment, and faster processing speeds.iPad is a revolutionary device and I find its design and build quality outstanding.  However, once the novelty wears off, it becomes apparent that it is best at supplementing your other mobile devices, not completely replacing them.The device is also fragile, so make sure to buy a sturdy case, especially if you plan to use your device in the field.

Reviews.Title: Completely what I expected!
Reviews.Author: Cirerram
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the product!I looked far and wide to find a sign of use but struggled to do so. I recieved a like new product relativly quickly. This is a very sound purchase to make.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: matalapa
Reviews.Content: the ipad2 are very nice. i use and work like new.good deale good produc.i love my ipad 2. thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: This Product is Amazing.
Reviews.Author: Samuel A. Yochmowitz "sombradeti"
Reviews.Content: This product is Amazing and I would recommend it to any level computer or tablet user. It runs fast and has basic functionality, and if you can't do what you want to do with it out of the box you can easily find software to add the feature.Pros:Camera on Both SidesSimple and effective User InterfaceBuilt in SpeakerRuns pretty fastOn Amazon you can find the 16,32, and 64 Gig editions of this second generation tabletCons:The Pricing on Amazon is not the cheapest you can find for the 16 Gig edition. You can go to an Apple store (base price $399 for the 16 Gig ) and get it cheaper than through Amazon's including Tax.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: DMoney
Reviews.Content: Product arrived in perfect condition, looked brand new and working as brand new despite knowing it was a refurbished product. Easy to set up the data plan just need to have access to wireless connection or a computer with iTunes in order to set up the iPad initially.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with product
Reviews.Author: maggie
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time, IPAD works great.  Should have bought it a year ago.  Love it. Did not need much time to get use to an Apple product.

Reviews.Title: IPAD 2
Reviews.Author: Chris (new_resource on Twitter)
Reviews.Content: I got it in 3 days, super fast. It's clean and awesome. My family thought it was brand new. So far as I learn to use it and load up the apps I'm loving it. If I wanted to nit-pick and this is nit-picky, I didn't like the bubble envelope it was packaged in, but that's about it. Everything else is cool.Thanks Amazon and thanks Encore Equipment!

Reviews.Title: Mostly amazing
Reviews.Author: Revan
Reviews.Content: My iPad 2 has worked great for me, and even though I originally expected that I would need more space, the 16 GBs have been plenty. However, this is my first tablet, and one thing I've noticed is that it's hard to do much besides watch movies, play games, and check email on them without some sort of a keyboard. The on-screen keyboard is just too clunky and hard to use to be very productive on. If this was easier to use, I'd give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Ipad2
Reviews.Author: CL.
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my iPad, never knew I would use it so much.  At first  had second thoughts about buying a used one but so far I love it and was taking care of .  I have jet to get a bill for it and don't understand that, no one at Amonazon seems to br able to help me with that.  Thanks for a good product.

Reviews.Title: Quality is there
Reviews.Author: R. Williams
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviewers have given all the pros and cons, so I won't bore you with another list here. Like most people, I use the iPad 90% of the time on just a few Apps. For me, reading an ebook, checking stock quotes, and reading the news constitute most of what I do. It's good to have half a million Apps, but it's impossible to use that many, or even a fraction of that. I've compared the iPad to the Kindle for reading ebooks. For me, the iPad is the clear winner. In my opinion, the iPad is easier to read and is sharper, also the color is a plus. The Kindle is hard to read in low light. Maybe if you are outside, the Kindle would have the edge, but I never read outside, and I think most people don't (possibly some do at the beach). I have an iPad 1 with WiFi and 3G, and an iPad 2 with WiFi only. I think the WiFi is the way to go because of the cost savings. Sometimes the 3G is nice, but I don't use it that often. Bottom line, I can recommend either model. It's reliable, easy to use, and Apple has the updates to improve things or fix any bugs that crop up.

Reviews.Title: Ipad2 Review
Reviews.Author: Gpvegas
Reviews.Content: The Ipad2 is a very good product. I bought it when it came out from Apple. Mine was stolen a year later and I bought this one from Amazon. It is exactly as advertised and is working in perfect condition. I saved about $150. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: iPad Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Larry Melton
Reviews.Content: I needed a larger memory on my iPad 2. Since they are only available in 16GB from apple, I was having a hard time finding a new one with 64GB, even online. Amazon had a vendor who was able to sell me the higher memory iPad at a reasonable price, and it was shipped promptly. I am very satisfied with this purchase from all points of service.

Reviews.Title: getting it new
Reviews.Author: J. Hayes "Videographer & Photographer"
Reviews.Content: my dad has an ipad i always play it and i refuse to say its less than awesome so now im getting my own

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: David Bowlin
Reviews.Content: Very quick and very sturdy feeling. The battery seems to last all day too. And tons of apps to use and play with.

Reviews.Title: Great good looking tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Juan Reinaldo Morales Gil
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible and a great good looking tablet, almost a laptop because you can all you want with it, i recommend it and i will buy again from this seller

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price
Reviews.Author: Paula O'Brien
Reviews.Content: I love the ipad for my personal use.  I bought it to test for business use, but found few applications that apply to my business. So now it is my personal device.  Great for photos, music, ibooks, etc.

Reviews.Title: iPad
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Great tablet plenty of gigabyte space.  Easily handable.  I would reccommend this product to everyone I knew because it is like a pc and does everything the same as a pc, but at a cheaper price...

Reviews.Title: Simply Awesome!
Reviews.Author: T. Noble
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with an iPad2 and I have to say I LOVE it! I tried to buy one from the Apple site but they no longer offer the 64 GB model. The seller shipped quickly and everything was as listed. There is so much to learn and so much one can do with this product. I am looking forward to using it!

Reviews.Title: Ipad2
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: I bought the Ipad as a graduation gift for my granddaughter. So far I am very pleased with it. It arrived on time and in great condition. It is being used more than I had imagined it would be! She has had absolutely no problems at all. She will be starting college and probably get great use out of it.

Reviews.Title: I love them iPad
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: The iPad is great and functions perfectly. I opted to get the 2nd generation with 3G and 64 gb  unit and have I activated the 3G which works good. After a little confusion regarding the shipping timeline, the seller upgraded the services to meet the expectations at no additional cost. One thing to keep in mind though is that the delivery requires a signature at delivery so for a residential delivery may get delayed if no one is home.

Reviews.Title: Love my new iPad!!!
Reviews.Author: Circuschica
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical to order from a new merchant with no ratings but I'm very happy I did.  I got an iPad at a great price and thought it was to good to be true but it was true.  I expected it to arrive next week but I got in 4 days sooner and was pleasantly surprise and very happy.  I will definitely buy from her again confident I'll get the same super fast deliver and quick response.

Reviews.Title: Should you purchase the iPad 2?
Reviews.Author: Neel

} } } Length:: 0:42 MinsThe iPad 2 was a great device. Nevertheless, the release of the New iPad brings forth a new question: Should you buy the now cheaper iPad 2?There are many factors to be considered when making this purchase. The main upgrades of the New iPad include retina display, faster processor, better cameras, and with iOS 6, siri. My family owns both the iPad 2 and the New iPad. Apple did not change the iPad much between these two generations. It kept the same battery life, the same thickness (almost), and the same design. Thus, it is a personal decision.The devices are very similar, and most of the cons of the iPad 2 are fixed in the New iPad. However, is the upgrade worth $100-150?Cons of iPad 2 and how the New iPad uses them:Lack of Retina Display: When the iPad 2 was released, retina display had already been seen in other apple devices, like the iPod touch 4th generation. The general public was disappointed by the lack of this feature in the iPad 2. The iPad 3 had this feature. However, I don't really notice the difference. They both appear to have excellent displays. The New iPad's improved display can only be identified in rare conditions, such as viewing upgraded apps or sharp photos. Overall, the retina display in the iPad increases the memory many apps in the app store take up. For example, many iPad 2 users posted bad reviews about Monopoly HD when they had an update that increased the memory that app took up extensively. The update of Monopoly HD did not bring any new features besides Retina display. iPad 2 users were angry because now they lost memory without any benefits.Lack of better Cameras: The iPad 2's cameras are terrible. They back facing camera is .7 megapixels. On a smaller screen this would be acceptable because it is still HD, but on a 10 in. screen photos shot by the iPad camera look pixelated. The New iPad is said to have 5 megapixel cameras. Even so, the cameras on the New iPad aren't that great. Look at the video I posted so you can see the difference yourself. The video is best viewed in full screen.Faster Processor: The iPad 2 has a decent processor and is capable of doing everything you can currently do on an iPad decently. The iPad 3 is faster, especially when loading apps. The upgrade is great but not necessary.Siri: With iOS 6, the New iPad will have exclusive new abilities like Siri. Although many are not appreciative of siri after seeing it on the iPhone, the fact that the New iPad will now have it suggests that apple will continue to do this. Apple's newest products will continue to receive features that older products won't have through updates. Thus, it may be a good idea to purchase the New iPad as another one is not expected soon.

Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Title: I=PAD 2
Reviews.Author: MaryC
Reviews.Content: So far, so good. I bought it 'like new' for $30 cheaper than a new I-Pad. Came quickly and so far product working fine.

Reviews.Title: Better than Ipad 1 and not that much different then the Retina...
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: Other than not having the Retina display and all those tiny features that come with it, this is the Ipad 2. Its thinner than the Ipad 1 and runs a bit sleeker. It's actually easier to hold than the Ipad 1 which got heavy at times when I was laying down and watching a movie or show on it before bed. It's nice to carry around for college classes then carrying around a laptop, which can get heavy. Great to take notes with, type papers up, edit photos, surf the web, read, watch tv/movies/netflix, pandora, and play games! This doesn't have the retina display but I don't really need that insane graphics. If you want something that is now cheaper than the Ipad retina get this as an alternative. It's a great Tablet and still sets the bar high! 5/5

Reviews.Author: Chip HIlton "65Longhorn"
Reviews.Content: The iPad 2 is the creme de la creme as you would expect from anything Apple makes.  I have no complaints. I have no doubt that I will purchase Apple's next generation iPad as well.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME

Reviews.Content: I was extremely satisfied when I received my ipad. It was exactly what the description had described. Brand new and at a great price. THanks

Reviews.Title: The best

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: AM

Reviews.Title: !!!WOW!!!

Reviews.Content: hands down this iPad smokes the competition - I am no Mac drone but this beats the H--L out of Android based tablets no question - I have a Lenovo K1 which just can't keep up with this iPad - maybe Apple shouldn't be a $600 stock but they sure make some real awesome technology

Reviews.Content: Can't say to much about the Ipad. It's made by Apple,it works as well as any other Apple product. The charger gets hot just as the Mac Book so we'll have to wait and see how long it lasts. As for the Ipad, SLICK toy!

Reviews.Title: Light weight, thing, easy to carry and great resolution

Reviews.Content: I gave my IPad to my daughter and got IPAD 2 recently. I must say that apple has done a great job with IPads. I cannot imagine using my pc anymore since my IPad meets all my needs and I take it where ever I need to go. Great product and great price and service by Amazon.
